xxl.core.util
Class ObjectPool

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.util.ObjectPool

public class ObjectPool
extends Object

An object pool allows the reuse of unneeded objects by storing them in a pool. The efford lies in avoiding the garbage collection and recreation of commonly used objects.

Field Summary
protected  int maxSize
          The maximum number of objects to be stored in the pool.
protected  Stack pool
          The object pool internally realized by a Stack.
protected  Function tupleFactory
          A parameterless function returning a new instance of an arbitrary object.
 
Constructor Summary
ObjectPool(Function tupleFactory, int maxSize)
          Constructs a new object pool.
 
Method Summary
 Object getObject()
          Retrieves an object from the pool if available, otherwise the result of tupleFactory.invoke() is returned.
 void releaseObject(Object done)
          Deliveres an object to the pool.
 void setMaxSize(int newMaxSize)
          Sets the maximum number of objects to be stored in the pool.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

A parameterless function returning a new instance of an arbitrary object.

The maximum number of objects to be stored in the pool.

The object pool internally realized by a Stack.

Constructor Detail

ObjectPool

public ObjectPool(Function tupleFactory,
                  int maxSize)
Constructs a new object pool.

Parameters:
tupleFactory - A parameterless function returning a new instance of an arbitrary object.
maxSize - The maximum number of objects to be stored in the pool.
Method Detail

setMaxSize

public void setMaxSize(int newMaxSize)
Sets the maximum number of objects to be stored in the pool.

Parameters:
newMaxSize - The maximum number of objects to be stored in the pool.

getObject

public Object getObject()
Retrieves an object from the pool if available, otherwise the result of tupleFactory.invoke() is returned.

Returns:
an object from the pool if available, otherwise tupleFactory.invoke().

releaseObject

public void releaseObject(Object done)
Deliveres an object to the pool. If the maximum size of the pool is not reached, the object is stored, otherwise it will be dropped.

Parameters:
done - The object to be delivered to the pool.
